title: Midpoint formula
text: The midpoint of the line segment whose endpoints are the two points $$(x_1,y_1)$$ and $$(x_2,y_2)$$ is $$(\frac{x_1+x_2}{2},\frac{y_1+y_2}{2})$$.

title: Plug in
text: Plug in the values for the equation. Choose a point to be the $$x_2$$ and $$y_2$$ pair, and use the other as the $$x_1$$ and $$y_1$$ pair. We get ((x_1+x_2)/2,(y_1+y_2)/2)=((4+3)/2),((-1+(-2))/2)).
